title.narrative: Strengthening an integrated approach to implementation and monitoring of human rights and the 2030 Agenda 2019-2021

description.narrative: Strengthening an integrated approach to implementation and monitoring of human rights and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in pilot developing countries 2019-2021, DIHR project

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nation's Office in Geneva

mailing-address.narrative: Mission permanente du Danemark auprés de l'Office des Nations Unies à Genéve, 56 rue de Moillebeau, Case Postale 435

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 1.1. Honduras: Relevant state actors have strengthened capacity and collaboration for integrated implementation of human rights and SDGs.

Capacity-strengthening activities conducted with the Secretaría de Coordinación General de Gobierno (SCGG), National Institute for Human Rights (CONADEH), Ministry of Human Rights (SEDH), National Bureau of Statistics, civil society networks, among others (at least 3 workshops / dialogues). Mapping document showing links between human rights obligations and SDG commitments; mapping of complaints against the SDGs; documentation of new structures and initiatives for integrated implementation, monitoring and reporting; published documentation on good practices.

target.value: Potential for integrated implementation and reporting is mapped through alignment of international obligations in the areas of human rights and sustainable development. SCGG. Ministry of Human Rights and the national and subnational branches of CONADEH explore opportunities to improved human rights delivery and protection through a coordinated approach with the development sector. Civil society is aware of the SDGs and its interconnection with human rights. and the SCGG facilitate stakeholders´ participation in SDG-related processes. Data sources and gaps are identified to facilitate integrated monitoring. Exploratory mapping of complaints received through NHRI complaint handling mechanism to SDGs. using artificial intelligence.

Inclusive and participatory structures for integrated implementation. monitoring and reporting are established. with focus on follow-up to UPR recommendations (next UPR in May 2020). Experimental integration of artificial intelligence toolkit into complaints handling system to facilitate processing and analysis. including with regard to the SDGs. Best practices for integrated implementation are documented and experiences are shared at regional and global levels.

title.narrative: Output 2.2. Tools, analysis and good practice on integrated approaches to SDG and human rights implementation are showcased at global level.

The Institute and partners (state actors and civil society) present tools and good practice on integrated implementation in dedicated international events and discussions at the Human Rights Council as well as the High-Level Political Forum for Sustainable Development (at least six events).

target.value: Presentations of practical experiences. tools and analysis of progress in SDG implementation measured against human rights obligations and recommendations. by the Institute and partners. Presentations at inter-sessional dialogue meeting of Human Rights Council on human rights and the 2030 Agenda. and at the High-Level Political Forum (including analysis of VNRs). as well as input to other ongoing discussions as relevant.

Presentations of practical experiences. tools and analysis of progress in SDG implementation measured against human rights obligations and recommendations. by the Institute and partners. Presentations at inter-sessional dialogue meeting of Human Rights Council on human rights and the 2030 Agenda. and at the High-Level Political Forum (including analysis of VNRs). as well as input to other ongoing discussions as relevant.
Presentations of practical experiences. tools and analysis by the Institute and partners at relevant events of Human Rights Council on human rights and 2030 Agenda. Input to other ongoing discussions as relevant.

title.narrative: Output 2.1. Tools, analysis and good practice on integrated approaches to SDG and human rights implementation are showcased at regional level.

Four side events or sessions conducted by the Institute and partners (state actors and civil society) in dedicated events at Regional Sustainable Development Platforms across Asia-Pacific, Africa, Latin America and Caribbean, and Europe in 2020 and 2021 (four per year).

target.value: The Institute arranges sessions or side events with partners at four regional platforms (ESCAP. ECA. ECLAC. ECE). involving state actors (government. NHRI. NSOs) and civil society (rights-holder groups).

The Institute arranges sessions or side events with partners at four regional platforms (ESCAP. ECA. ECLAC. ECE). involving state actors (government. NHRI. NSOs) and civil society (rights-holder groups).

title.narrative: Output 1.3. Indonesia: Komnas HAM (the NHRI) has strengthened its capacity for promoting integrated implementation of human rights and SDGs and collaborate with relevant state actors for integrated implementation of human rights and SDGs.

Training of Komnas HAM staff; preliminary mapping of complaints against SDG goals and targets; published policy brief; Documented interaction between Komnas HAM, the SDG Secretariat of the Ministry of National Development Planning (BAPPENAS), the National Bureau of Statistics, and the Ministry of Law and Human Rights (at least 3 workshops or dialogues); Komnas HAM communications to regional SDG working group (at least 2).

target.value: a) Capacity building of key staff of Komnas HAM on the SDGs and human rights b) Scoping process by Komnas HAM analysing options for strategic engagement in SDG-processes in Indonesia. c) Exploratory mapping of complaints received through NHRI complaint handling mechanism to SDGs d) Launch and dissemination of policy brief outlining the human rights dimension of the 2030 Agenda in Indonesia. highlighting Komnas HAM's expertise and recommendations. e) Technical support to Komnas HAM’s strategic planning in relation to the SDGs.

a) Komnas HAM engages in dialogues with relevant ministries and other national actors to bring a human rights perspective to SDG implementation. monitoring and reporting. b) Experimental integration of artificial intelligence toolkit into complaints handling system to facilitate processing and analysis. including with regard to the SDGs c) Komnas HAM actively engages with. and where possible leads. regional NHRI engagement with SDG processes. with technical assistance from the Institute.
Best practices for integrated implementation are documented and experiences are shared at regional and global levels.

title.narrative: Output 1.2. Kenya: Relevant tools and analysis are developed, and capacity building and dialogue have taken place to facilitate improved coordination and collaboration between key state actors on a human rights-based approach to sustainable development.

Context-specific analysis and tools are available and used by key state and other actors , capacity is built among key state actors, and dialogue and joint activities between the KNCHR and state actors informed by the KNCHR’s data and analysis have been initiated; a policy paper on a HRBA to implementation of the current development plan is published; at least one training has taken place with targeted state and other actors; complaints to the KNCHR have been categorized and analysed through and SDG lens; at least one concrete direct collaboration between state actor(s) and the KNCHR has been established; and KNCHR has produced at least two monitoring reports that integrate an SDG lens to the recommendations provided to the State.

target.value: a) Strategic entry points for the promotion of a human rights-based approach in the implementation of Kenya’s current Medium-Term Development Plan III have been identified through a scoping exercise. and development of a policy paper and engagement plan have been finalized. b) Key state actors have been trained on HRBA to SDGs and are being engaged regularly by KNCHR. c) KNCHR’s existing databases of complaints and other human rights information is categorised and used to produce analysis to feed into SDG-related policy work.

a) Specific joint activities have been undertaken by KNCHR with relevant state actors with a view to enhancing a HRBA to data. b) Direct collaboration between KNCHR and key state actors on a human rights-based approach to SDG implementation and monitoring is informing key strategic areas of SDG implementation. c) KNCHR has integrated an SDG lens in its methodologies and tools for monitoring and follow-up to human rights recommendations in Kenya. d) SDG-human rights reporting for 2 key KNCHR reports (one national and one international) has been undertaken and follow up to recommendations is being undertaken.
Best practices for integrated implementation are documented and experiences are shared at regional and global levels.

title.narrative: Documented peer-learning and multiplier effect related to regional and global dialogues of experiences with approaches, tools and guidance for integrated implementation and monitoring of human rights and SDGs.

target.value: Concrete experience and operational practice around integrated monitoring and implementation of human rights and SDGs play a prominent role in regional and global SDG discussions.

title.narrative: Documentation of institutionalised steps towards integrated implementation and monitoring of human rights and the 2030 Agenda in Honduras, Indonesia and Kenya.

target.value: Relevant state institutions in Honduras. Indonesia and Kenya apply human rights standards and recommendations in their SDG implementation and monitoring. including through cooperation with their NHRIs.
